intro: Capraria montevidensis var. intermedia, commonly known as the Montevideo capraria, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Uruguay and parts of Brazil. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It has slender, hairy stems and small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal in gardens.
